issue.title: pip install pyarrow fails on AArch64, Fedora 33
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-11834](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-11834). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
[jw@cn06 jw]$ pip3 install pyarrow
Defaulting to user installation because normal site-packages is not writeable
Collecting pyarrow
  Using cached pyarrow-3.0.0.tar.gz (682 kB)
  Installing build dependencies ... done
  Getting requirements to build wheel ... done

Requirement already satisfied: numpy>=1.16.6 in /home/jw/.local/lib/python3.9/site-packages (from pyarrow) (1.19.5)

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-11834?focusedCommentId=17294028) by Kouhei Sutou (kou):*
We don't provide wheel for AArch64 yet.
You need to install Apache Arrow C++ https://arrow.apache.org/docs/developers/cpp/building.html#building-arrow-cpp before you run `pip3 install pyarrow`.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-11834?focusedCommentId=17343380) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
Closing as not a bug. `[~LutzWeischerFujitsu]`   Do note we provide Aarch64 manylinux wheels for PyArrow 4.0.0.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-11834?focusedCommentId=17344369) by Lutz Weischer (LutzWeischerFujitsu):*
Confirming, v4.0.0 installs. Thanks!
